Material used.Description: Human SH-SY5Y cells were used for co-immunoprecipitation analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 interacts with parkin, and this interaction is not affected by PINK1 pathogenic mutations or kinase-dead mutation.
PINK1 interacts with parkin, and this interaction is not affected by PINK1 pathogenic mutations or kinase-dead mutation.
The RING-finger 1 domain, but not parkin E3 ligase activity, is required for the interaction of parkin with PINK1.
The RING-finger 1 domain, but not parkin E3 ligase activity, is required for the interaction of parkin with PINK1.
The RING-finger 1 domain, but not parkin E3 ligase activity, is required for the interaction of parkin with PINK1.

Material used.Description: In vitro kinase assays were performed by incubation of affinity-purified FLAG-tagged wild-type or mutant PINK1 with Myc-tagged parkin.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: PINK1 kinase activity is required for phosphorylation of parkin.
Readout description.Result Description: In vitro phosphorylation of parkin by PINK1 was abrogated by PD-linked PINK1 pathogenic mutations G309D and L347P.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: PINK1 kinase activity is required for phosphorylation of parkin.
Readout description.Result Description: In vitro phosphorylation of parkin by PINK1 was abrogated by PD-linked PINK1 pathogenic mutations G309D and L347P.

Basic positive control.Description: The reaction mixtures were resolved by SDS–PAGE, and phosphorylation of parkin was determined by immunoblotting with antiphosphoserine and anti-phosphothreonine antibodies.

Basic negative control.Description: The reaction mixtures were resolved by SDS–PAGE, and phosphorylation of parkin was determined by immunoblotting with antiphosphoserine and anti-phosphothreonine antibodies.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vivo and in vitro ubiquitination assays

Material used.Description: In vivo ubiquitination assays were performed as we described previously.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: PINK1 kinase activity is required for the ability of PINK1 to promote parkin-mediated IKKg polyubiquitination.
Readout description.Result Description: The parkin-mediated IKKg polyubiquitination was significantly increased by co-expression of wild-type PINK1.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: PINK1 kinase activity is required for the ability of PINK1 to promote parkin-mediated IKKg polyubiquitination.
Readout description.Result Description: The parkin-mediated IKKg polyubiquitination was significantly increased by co-expression of wild-type PINK1.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were performed in triplicate and repeated at least three times.

Technical replicates.Description: All experiments were performed in triplicate and repeated at least three times.

Basic positive control.Description: The reaction mixtures were resolved by SDS–PAGE, and ubiquitination was detected by immunoblotting.

Basic negative control.Description: The reaction mixtures were resolved by SDS–PAGE, and ubiquitination was detected by immunoblotting.

Statistical analysis method.Description: Data were subjected to statistical analysis by ANOVA and a P-value of less than 0.05 was considered statistically significant.
